articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: IT’S ALL wonderfully commendable that Reo Hatate is quite happy to travel from here to Timbuktu – or, more accurately, Jeddah – to sit on a substitutes’ bench to get a good view of Japan in action. There is no place for the midfielder in manager Hajime Moriyasu’s plans, but there are no complaints from [...]
articles.title: ALEX’S ANGLE: TIME TO CONCENTRATE ON CELTIC, REO

articles.description: GOAL HERO Liam Scales is hoping Republic of Ireland adopt Celtic’s winning mentality after their 2-1 UEFA Nations League triumph against Finland in Helsinki. The international team had gone through a tough and prolonged barren spell until the Hoops defender inspired his country with a brilliant equaliser to steer them towards three crucial points from [...]

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Liam Scales is often judged against his central defensive partner, the impeccable Cameron Carter-Vickers.  It is only when Cameron is out and we see Liam as the senior partner in defence that we get to appreciate the gap between him and those aspiring to replace him. After around a year as first choice at Shamrock [...]
articles.title: We have developed a genuine player

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BARCELONA kid Alex Valle has only been at Celtic for 44 days, but has already played in THREE different competitions. The 20-year-old left-back made his first start when he was pitched in against Falkirk in the Premier Sports League Cup quarter-final at Parkhead. It was an eye-opener for the attack-minded defender who signed a season-long [...]
articles.title: ‘AWESOME,’ COLD COMFORT FOR NEW BHOY

articles.description: REO HATATE was a no-show again as Japan beat Saudia Arabia 2-0 in their World Cup qualifier in Jeddah. The Celtic midfielder remained an unused substitute while club team-mate Daizen Maeda came off the bench in the 63rd minute. The Blue Samuria maintained their perfect start to the competition with three successive wins and 14 [...]

articles.description: LUIS PALMA has been reassured by Brendan Rodgers he has a vital role to play in his plans for Celtic. However, Palma was hooked just after the [...]

articles.description: This time last year we were glowing at the dramatic win at Fir Park, which saw Luis Palma and Matt O’Riley score either side of a Motherwell goal in added time.  Luis scored two of our five Champions League goals last season and by Christmas looked like a successful summer buy. Form dropped off across the [...]
articles.title: Palma laying down a marker

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: GEORGE BALDOCK, who had been a Celtic target in July 2021, has tragically died at the age of 31. The Sheffield United right-back had been a priority signing aim for Ange Postecoglou shortly after he arrived at Parkhead to rebuild the squad. The £4million-rated Baldrock, however, stayed put at the Bramall Lane club, but eventually moved [...]

articles.description:
Homeward bound after a great wee midweek away day watching Celtic. A friendly against League of Ireland team Sligo Rovers may not have the same excitement for Celtic fans as a Champions League away trip. But any Celtic fan who was in Sligo yesterday could only be impressed by the welcome they received from the […]
